ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: A kernel of functions for programming time series methods in a way that is relatively independently of the representation of time. Also provides plotting, time windowing, and some other utility functions which are specifically intended for time series. See the Guide distributed as a vignette, or ?tframe.Intro for more details. (User utilities are in package tfplot.)

A kernel of functions for programming time series methods in a way that is relatively independently of the representation of time. Also provides plotting, time windowing, and some other utility functions which are specifically intended for time series. See the Guide distributed as a vignette, or ?tframe.Intro for more details. (User utilities are in package tfplot.)

name: r-tframe
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '2015.12-1.1' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-tframe
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/tframe_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/tframe/tframe_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 23c4e1e2d8ee8c41647f0d2d281df554908abed9aa8abffe38b706f8a510cef9

build:
  number: 4
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('tframe')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('tframe')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://tsanalysis.r-forge.r-project.org/
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: A kernel of functions for programming time series methods in a way that is relatively
    independently of the representation of time. Also provides plotting, time windowing,
    and some other utility functions which are specifically intended for time series.
    See the Guide distributed as a vignette, or ?tframe.Intro for more details. (User
    utilities are in package tfplot.)
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - LeoDtrt
